text: The Manchester Ship Canal is a wide, long, river navigation in North West England, opened on 21 May 1894. At the time of its completion, it was the largest navigation canal in the world.Owen (1983), p. 120. It consists of the rivers Irwell and Mersey made navigable for seagoing ships from the Mersey Estuary to Salford Docks in Greater Manchester. It transformed Manchester from a landlocked city into a major sea port. ==References== == Other websites == *Virtual Tour Category:North West England Category:Canals in England Category:Salford Category:Manchester Category:1894 establishments in the United Kingdom
title: Manchester Ship Canal
